characteristics.slogan: Can grow to more than 8 meters long!

characteristics.prey: Smaller sharks and small whales, herring, cod and other fish, seals and squid.
characteristics.other_name(s): Gurry, eqalussuaq, grey shark, sleeper shark
characteristics.habitat: Deep, cold, waters of the North Atlantic and the Arctic Oceans.
characteristics.favorite_food: Greenland shark food includes fish, marine mammals and carrion.

characteristics.slogan: One of the most common shark species!

characteristics.predators: Tiger Shark, Great White Shark, Killer Whale, Humans
characteristics.slogan: Found in coastal waters around the world!

characteristics.habitat: Kelp beds and rocks close to the shore
characteristics.slogan: Endemic to the Californian coast!
characteristics.lifespan: 12 years in captivity, perhaps 25 or even 50 years in the wild

characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: Tremendously large mouth full of teeth

characteristics.habitat: Warm waters and tropical coastal regions
characteristics.slogan: Commonly found in Central American waters!

characteristics.prey: Bony fish, squid, shell fish, and sharks
characteristics.other_name(s): Atlantic Mackerel Shark, Bottle-nosed Shark, and Blue Dog

characteristics.prey: Bony fish, octopus, squid, rays and stingrays, sea lions, marine iguanas, trash, shrimp and crabs
characteristics.estimated_population_size: Tens of thousands, but populations are declining
characteristics.other_name(s): Blunt head shark, light-tip shark, whitetip shark, reef whitetip shark, blacktip shark, black-finned shark, blackfin reef shark, reef blacktip shark, guliman, black-vee whaler, bronze whaler, Fowler's whaler shark, graceful shark, graceful whaler shark, school shark, longnose blacktail shark, shortnose blacktail shark
characteristics.habitat: Coral reefs, lagoons, mangroves, grassy sea bed

characteristics.prey: Sea lion, seals, humans, small fishes, and invertebrates
characteristics.biggest_threat: Killer whales, sperm whales and humans
characteristics.favorite_food: Sea lion, seals, humans, small fishes, and invertebrates

characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: The massive rows of comb-like teeth
characteristics.predators: Humans, orcas, sharks, dolphins, and sea lions

characteristics.favorite_food: Small bony fish ponds, streams, ocean, etc

characteristics.habitat: Warm coastal waters and open ocean
characteristics.slogan: The largest species of fish in the world!

characteristics.prey: Rodents, rabbits, hares, gophers, reptiles, amphibians, small birds, and insects
characteristics.nesting_location: Cliffs, trees, and other high structures

characteristics.prey: Hares, squirrels, grouse, pigeons, doves, crows, and others
characteristics.predators: Owls, wolves, hawks, eagles, and martens

characteristics.prey: Other birds, lizards, small mammals, large insects
characteristics.other_name(s): Harris’s hawk, bay-winged hawk, dusky hawk, peuco
characteristics.habitat: Semi-arid areas such as scrubland and chaparral
characteristics.predators: Coyotes, large owls, bobcats and ravens
characteristics.location: Southwestern United States, Mexico, Central and South America
characteristics.nesting_location: Cacti, bushes, trees or artificial structures
characteristics.lifespan: 10 to 12 years in the wild, as much as 25 years in captivity
characteristics.length: 18.11 to 29.92 inches, females larger in size than males

characteristics.prey: Birds, insects, rodents, and other mammals
characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: The barred plumage on the breast
characteristics.predators: Eagles, owls, falcons, goshawks, red foxes, and martens

characteristics.habitat: Desert scrub, rainforests, grassland, open arid or semi-arid locations
characteristics.location: every continent except Europe and Antartica
characteristics.lifespan: A few weeks to four to five months

characteristics.distinctive_feature: Large body size and powerful jaws
characteristics.slogan: Can grow to nearly 2 meters long!

characteristics.prey: Krill, fish, zooplankton, phytoplankton, and algae

characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: Pleats on neck and two blow-holes
characteristics.slogan: The largest animal on Earth

characteristics.other_name(s): Greenland Right Whale, Arctic Whale, Polar Whale, Steeple-Top, Russian Whale
characteristics.lifespan: Unknown, but may be 200 years or more

characteristics.distinctive_feature: Pointed snout and two blowholes on top of head
characteristics.slogan: Found throughout ocean waters worldwide!

characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: The small hump on the back
characteristics.slogan: There are thought to be 80,000 left in the wild!
Typically consumes over 200 kg of food a day!

characteristics.main_prey: Krill, herring, sand eels, sprat, capelin, silverfish, and lanternfish
characteristics.estimated_population_size: Common Minke Whale: 180,000; Antarctic Minke Whale: 515,000
characteristics.other_name(s): Lesser Rorqual, Lesser Finback, Sharp-Headed Finner, Little Finner, Pike Whale
characteristics.habitat: Temperate, tropic, or sub tropic waters
characteristics.slogan: There are two recognised species!

characteristics.prey: Krill and other euphausiids, copepods, small fish and squid
characteristics.other_name(s): Japan finner, lesser fin whale, pollock whale, sardine whale, coalfish, Rudolph’s rorqual

characteristics.distinctive_feature: Cone-shaped teeth and enormous body size
characteristics.slogan: Each tooth weighs 1kg!
Horns can grow to 1.5m!
Also known as the one-horned rhino!
Only has a 25cm long horn!
It's horns are made from keratin!
The smallest species of rhino!
The second largest animal on the land!

characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: Ears, eyes and nostrils on top of the head
characteristics.slogan: Has pink anti-bacterial sweat!
Spends more time on land than in water!

characteristics.predators: Human poaching and competition with Siberian tigers
characteristics.slogan: The Amur leopard may be the rarest big cat on Earth!
characteristics.lifespan: 10 - 15 years in wild; up to 20 in captivity

characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: Dark cloud-like markings and long tail
characteristics.slogan: Has canines that can be two inches long!

characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: Dense patterned fur and long, sharp teeth
characteristics.slogan: Spends much of the time high in the trees!

characteristics.main_prey: Insects, Mollusks, birds, Worms, snakes, frogs
characteristics.predators: Various, including raccoons, foxes, snakes, birds, frogs, humans
characteristics.location: From southern Canada through northern South America

characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: Lacks sticky foot pads like most gecko species; has fully-functional eyelids; is able to drop its tail as a defense mechanism (autotomy)
characteristics.habitat: Arid, rocky deserts and scrublands throughout the Middle East; countries include India, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Nepal, and Iran
characteristics.favorite_food: Crickets, mealworms, superworms, waxworms, dubia roaches
characteristics.lifespan: Roughly 8 to 15 years (lives longer in captivity on average)

characteristics.prey: Smaller lizards, insects, rodents, berries, leaves
characteristics.length: up to 12 inches head to tip of tail

characteristics.habitat: Cold waters of the southern hemisphere
characteristics.slogan: The world's most aggressive seal species!

characteristics.distinctive_feature: Large body size and protective, patterned shell
characteristics.slogan: The most widely distributed tortoise in Africa!

characteristics.prey: sheep, deer, antelopes, yaks and gazelles and smaller mammals and birds
characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: Pale gray coat and gray spots
characteristics.predators: Leopards, occasionally and other snow leopards

characteristics.slogan: Natively found in the Andes Mountain range!

characteristics.estimated_population_size: The population of is unknown, but it is decreasing and the bird’s conservation status is near threatened. There are about 1000 individuals on Palau as of 2021.
characteristics.biggest_threat: Habitat destruction, hunting, collection for the illegal pet trade
characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: The colors of its long, iridescent feathers
characteristics.other_name(s): Hackled pigeon, vulturine pigeon or white-tailed pigeon
characteristics.location: Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Solomon Islands, Palau, islands in the Malay Archipelago
characteristics.lifespan: 8 to 12 years in the wild, and 10 to 15 years in captivity

characteristics.slogan: Thought to have been domesticated in 9,000 BC!

characteristics.prey: Grain, seeds, berries, fruits, and occasionally insects, snails, earthworms.
characteristics.biggest_threat: Inference from humans either in the form of pest control or urbanization
characteristics.most_distinctive_feature: White rump and metallic purple/ green iridescence on males
characteristics.habitat: Often found in towns and cities, as well as farmlands, fields, and rocky cliffs
